title: Eir Sport 2
text:
Eir Sport 2 (stylised as eir Sport 2, formerly Setanta Sports 1) was an <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland">Irish</a> <a href="pay%20television">pay television</a> channel owned by Setanta Sports Channel Ireland.
The channel carried coverage of <a href="association%20football">association football</a> (including top-flight European leagues and <a href="UEFA%20Europa%20League">UEFA Europa League</a>), boxing, golf, motorsport, and coverage of the SSE Airtricity League.
On 16 December 2013 Setanta Sports launched a high-definition of Setanta Sports 1. Setanta Sports 1 HD was first exclusively available through <a href="Virgin%20Media%20Ireland">Virgin Media Ireland</a>, but later launched on Sky on 20 July 2015, along with Premier Sports HD.
On 15 August 2019, Eir Sport and <a href="Virgin%20Media%20Sport">Virgin Media Sport</a> contracted a deal to show <a href="Virgin%20Media%20Sport%20%28TV%20channel%29">Virgin Media Sport</a> on <a href="Eir%20Vision">Eir Vision</a> and Eir Sport 1 on <a href="Virgin%20Media%20Ireland">Virgin Media Ireland</a>.
As per eir's announcement on 19 May 2021, Eir Sport 2 closed on 20 July 2021. Eir also announced that <a href="Eir%20Sport%201">Eir Sport 1</a> will also close before the end of 2021.
Broadcast rights.
Most of these aired on both <a href="Setanta%20Ireland">Setanta Ireland</a> and Setanta Sports 1 and were shared between the two channels. In some instances (largely <a href="association%20football">football</a> coverage) Setanta only possessed <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland">Republic of Ireland</a> rights, during such programming the channel is unavailable in <a href="Northern%20Ireland">Northern Ireland</a>. Conversely, live coverage of GAA Championship matches was available only in Northern Ireland and not the Republic.
Other programming.
Setanta's major in-house programme was "The Sports Show" (formerly "The Hub") which aired daily. It also simulcasted the radio show Off The Ball from <a href="Newstalk">Newstalk</a>.
Setanta Sports Cup.
Setanta was the sponsor of the <a href="Setanta%20Sports%20Cup">Setanta Sports Cup</a>, an annual soccer tournament which featured teams from the <a href="League%20of%20Ireland">League of Ireland</a> and <a href="IFA%20Premiership">Irish Football League</a>.
Availability.
As of July 2016 in the <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland">Republic of Ireland</a>, the Eir Sport Package was available for free to any Eir broadband customer. This included the <a href="BT%20Sport">BT Sport</a> package. Additionally the Eir Sport Package was available on <a href="Eir">Eir TV</a>, <a href="Virgin%20Media%20Ireland">Virgin Media Ireland</a>, <a href="Sky%20Ireland">Sky Ireland</a> and <a href="Vodafone%20Ireland">Vodafone TV</a>. Eir Sport offered commercial venues in Ireland programming of sports such as <a href="association%20football">football</a> (soccer), <a href="Gaelic%20football">Gaelic football</a>, <a href="hurling">hurling</a>, <a href="golf">golf</a>, <a href="cricket">cricket</a>, <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> and <a href="boxing">boxing</a>.
On 12 September 2019, Eir Sport 2 was removed from Sky in Ireland and was replaced by <a href="Virgin%20Media%20Sport%20%28TV%20channel%29">Virgin Media Sport</a>. On 13 August 2020, Virgin Media Sport's feeds on <a href="Eir%20%28telecommunications%29">Eir</a> and <a href="Sky%20Ireland">Sky Ireland</a> that were provided by Eir were replaced by Eir Sport 2 on those platforms, as Eir refused to pay the contracted distribution license fee.
